revised_title: The Evolution of Symbiont-Mediated Cellulolytic Capacity in Insects
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of cellulose digestion in insects, focusing on the role of symbiotic relationships with microorganisms. It explores the different mechanisms of cellulose digestion in insects, such as the exploitation of protozoan and bacterial symbionts in the gut. The article also highlights the importance of studying insect cellulases to better understand the evolution of cellulose digestion.
